articles.author: Imani Moise
articles.title: New Wells Fargo CEO brings Wall Street swagger to storied bank
articles.description: Charles Scharf will make his public debut as Wells Fargo & Co’s chief executive during the bank’s quarterly earnings call on Tuesday, and those who have worked with him in the past say he is likely to strike a much different chord than his predecessors.
articles.content: (Reuters) - Charles Scharf will make his public debut as Wells Fargo & Co’s (WFC.N) chief executive during the bank’s quarterly earnings call on Tuesday, and those who have worked with him in the past say he is likely to strike a much different chord than… [+3209 chars]

articles.author: Kamal Ayash
articles.title: Hours of forewarning saved U.S., Iraqi lives from Iran's missile attack
articles.description: Nearly eight hours before Iran’s Jan. 8 missile attack on U.S. forces at bases in Iraq, American and Iraqi soldiers at Ain al-Asad air base scrambled to move personnel and weaponry to fortified bunkers, two Iraqi officers stationed at the base told Reuters.

articles.author: Guy Faulconbridge
articles.title: Britain secretly funded Reuters in 1960s and 1970s: documents
articles.description: The British government secretly funded Reuters in the 1960s and 1970s at the behest of an anti-Soviet propaganda unit linked to British intelligence and concealed the funding by using the BBC to make the payments, declassified government documents show.
articles.content: LONDON (Reuters) - The British government secretly funded Reuters in the 1960s and 1970s at the behest of an anti-Soviet propaganda unit linked to British intelligence and concealed the funding by using the BBC to make the payments, declassified government do… [+3554 chars]

articles.author: Emma Farge
articles.title: Climate change protest at bank 'necessary and proportional': Swiss judge
articles.description: The imminent danger posed by climate change means activists were not guilty of trespassing when they occupied a Swiss bank and played tennis to demand an end to funding of fossil fuel projects, a judge ruled on Monday.
articles.content:
LAUSANNE, Switzerland (Reuters) - The imminent danger posed by climate change means activists were not guilty of trespassing when they occupied a Swiss bank and played tennis to demand an end to funding of fossil fuel projects, a judge ruled on Monday. 
Wear… [+2810 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Eight people injured in stabbing spree in Colorado Springs: local media
articles.description: A man was taken into custody after stabbing eight people at multiple locations in Colorado Springs on Monday morning, local media reported.
articles.content:
(Reuters) - A man was taken into custody after stabbing eight people at multiple locations in Colorado Springs on Monday morning, local media reported. 
The stabbing spree lasted about an half an hour and occurred near walking trails in the city of 460,000 p… [+623 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Bank of Canada says business outlook data released early, regrets error - Reuters
articles.description: The Bank of Canada on Monday said it mistakenly published data from a quarterly business outlook survey on its website nine minutes early.
articles.content:
OTTAWA (Reuters) - The Bank of Canada on Monday said it mistakenly published data from a quarterly business outlook survey on its website nine minutes early. 
"The Bank regrets this error and is initiating a review of its publication process," Canada's centr… [+68 chars]

articles.author: Lisa Richwine
articles.title: Oscar voters snub J.Lo, Eddie Murphy and De Niro; Banderas lands first nomination
articles.description: Hollywood's Oscar voters snubbed big names including Jennifer Lopez, Eddie Murphy and Robert De Niro on Monday, while issuing a surprise first Academy Award nomination to actor Antonio Banderas for Spanish film "Pain and Glory."
articles.content:
(Reuters) - Hollywood’s Oscar voters snubbed big names including Jennifer Lopez, Eddie Murphy and Robert De Niro on Monday, while issuing a surprise first Academy Award nomination to actor Antonio Banderas for Spanish film “Pain and Glory.”

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Eight injured after Colorado Springs stabbing
articles.description: A man is in custody after going on a stabbing spree around Colorado Springs on Monday, police said. Yahaira Jacquez reports.
articles.content:
Posted 
A man is in custody after going on a stabbing spree around Colorado Springs on Monday, police said. Yahaira Jacquez reports.

articles.author: John Miller
articles.title: Novartis to speed access to $10 billion heart drug via NHS deal
articles.description: Novartis and Britain's National Health Service (NHS) on Monday announced a pact that will clear the way for accelerated review by the country's health watchdog NICE for heart drug inclisiran, which could make it broadly available as soon as 2021.
articles.content: ZURICH (Reuters) - Novartis (NOVN.S) and Britain’s National Health Service (NHS) on Monday announced a pact that will clear the way for accelerated review by the country’s health watchdog NICE for heart drug inclisiran, which could make it broadly available a… [+2597 chars]

articles.author: Aditi Shah
articles.title: Air safety watchdog extends deadline for IndiGo to replace Pratt & Whitney engines
articles.description: India's aviation regulator has given IndiGo more time to replace the Pratt & Whitney engines on its fleet of Airbus A320neo planes which have been linked to in-flight engine shutdowns, a statement released by the watchdog said on Monday.
